title: Smart K-Means Analysis for Social Exclusion Indicators
description: This exploratory research proposes a new method for representing multidimensional phenomena based on the k-means algorithm. The so-called 'smart k-means' uses the Shannon entropy index to identify and discard individual indicators with low informational diversity, which do not distinguish decision-making units adequately. This discard process ensures groups have acceptable cohesion and resolution and are within the number of group arrangements desired by the decision maker. The results of applying the new method to represent social exclusion show that discarding individual indicators of low informational diversity ensures obtaining internally homogeneous and externally heterogeneous groups. These results contribute to a reliable representation of the multidimensional phenomenon, facilitating its understanding and the development of public policies to reduce it.
